isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Diagnostics Manual - Diagnostic Software Operation - Diagnostic Tests - Key-On Engine-Off Tests

svcsubproc.title: Standard Test
svcsubproc.para: The KOEO Standard test is done by the ECM. The technician runs this test, using the EST.

During the KOEO Standard test, the ECM does an internal test of its processing components and memory followed by an Output Circuit Check (OCC). The OCC evaluates the electrical condition of the circuits, not the mechanical or hydraulic performance of the systems. By operating the ECM output circuits and measuring each response, the Standard test detects shorts or opens in the harnesses, actuators, and ECM. If a circuit fails the test, a fault is logged and a DTC is set.

table.title: ECM checks circuits for the following:

entry.para: Horizontal Fuel Conditioning Module (HFCM) fuel pump relay

svcsubproc.para: When the OCC is done, the DTC window will display DTCs, if there are problems.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, use care to prevent contact with the door edge when the cab is up and the door is open.

step1.para: Set parking brake.
Turn ignition switch to ON. (Do not crank the engine.)
Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off tests from the drop down menu.
From the KOEO Diagnostics menu, select Standard and Run to start the test.

note.para: When using the EST to do KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard test does not have to be run again.
Read and be familiar with all steps and time limits in this procedure before starting.

step1.para: Set parking brake.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, use care to prevent contact with the door edge when the cab is up and the door is open.

step1.para: Turn ignition switch to ON. (Do not crank the engine.)
Press and release the top of CRUISE RPM and RESUME+ switches simultaneously, press and release RESUME+ switch again, within 3 seconds of turning the ignition switch on.

item.para: The ECM will begin the Output Circuit Check (OCC).
When the OCC is done, the ECM will flash the red warning and amber caution lamps to signal the DTCs.

note.para: The top of CRUISE RPM switch is not labeled. Pressing the top of CRUISE RPM will latch the switch and illuminate a small red light at the top, indicating that cruise is on.
There could be as much as a 60 second delay from the time switches are pressed to the time DTCs are flashed.

step1.para: Press the bottom of CRUISE RPM switch to unlatch.

svcsubproc.title: Standard Test Using Cruise Switches (Stripped Chassis)

step1.para: Set parking brake.
Turn ignition switch to ON. (Do not crank the engine.)
Move slide switch from OFF to R/A and then release.
Move slide switch to R/A within three seconds and standard test will run.

svcsubproc.title: Injector Test

note.para: The Injector test can only be done with the EST; MasterDiagnostics® software is required. The Standard test must be done before doing the Injector test.

svcsubproc.para: The Injector test diagnoses electrical problems in IDM wiring or injectors.

note.para: Before doing the Injector test, DTCs should be accessed, noted, and cleared. This allows DTCs found to be displayed as Active DTCs.

svcsubproc.para: During the Injector test, the ECM requests the IDM actuate the injectors in numerical order (1 through 6), not in firing order. The IDM monitors the electrical circuit for each injector, evaluates the performance of the injector coils, and checks the operation of the electrical circuit. If an electronic component in the injector drive circuit fails the expected parameters, the IDM sends a fault to the ECM. The ECM logs the fault, a DTC is set and sent to the EST.

note.para: The technician can monitor injector operation by listening to the sound of each injector when activated by the IDM. During Hard Start and No Start conditions, when oil is very cold and thick, injectors may be hard to hear.

svcsubproc.para: The DTC window will display DTCs, if there are problems.

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off Tests from the drop down menu.

note.para: When using the EST to do KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: From the KOEO Diagnostics menu, select Injector and click Run to start the test.

note.para: During the Injector test, injector solenoids should click when actuated. If a series of clicks are not heard for each injector, one or more injectors are not activating.

svcsubproc.title: Continuous Monitor Test

note.para: This test can only be done with the EST; MasterDiagnostics® software is required.

svcsubproc.para: The Continuous Monitor test troubleshoots intermittent connections between the ECM and sensors. The engine can be off or running.

table.title: EST monitors circuits for the following :

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, use care to prevent contact with the door edge when the cab is up and the door is open.

step1.para: Select D_ContinuousMonitor.ssn from the Open Session File window and select Open to open the session.
Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off Tests from the drop down menu.
From the KOEO Diagnostics menu, select Continuous Monitor and select Run to start the test.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, be careful around rotating parts (belts and fan) and hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Wiggle connectors and wires at all suspected problem locations. If circuit continuity is interrupted, the EST will display DTCs related to the condition.
Correct problem causing active DTCs.
Clear DTCs.
When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.

svcsubproc.title: Output State Low Test

note.para: This test can only be done with the EST; MasterDiagnostics® software is required.

svcsubproc.para: The Output State Low test allows the technician to diagnose the operation of the output signals and actuators.
In the Output State Low test mode, the ECM pulls down the output voltage to the low state. This actuates the output components controlled by the ECM, grounding the circuits.

During Output State Low test, the output of the circuit in question can be monitored with a Digital Multimeter (DMM). The DMM measures a low voltage state as the outputs are toggled. The actual voltage will vary with the circuit tested.

item.para: A Breakout Box or Breakout Harness and a DMM are required to monitor the suspected circuit or actuator.
DTCs are not set by the ECM during this test.

table.title: The following actuators are activated when toggled low:

entry.para: Engine Fan (EFAN) relay (optional) (electrical circuit and inspect if clutch is engaged)
EGR (audible and visual inspection only) continuous monitoring by EGR valve drive module.

Boost Control Solenoid (BCS) (electrical circuit only) visual inspection of actuator arm movement when pressurized with regulated air source. When in low, air is directed to the pneumatic actuator, air bypasses the pneumatic actuator when toggled high.
Glow plug lamp (CF only - amber WAIT TO START)
Warn engine lamp (CF only - amber engine outline with check mark)
Oil/water lamp (CF only - red engine outline with exclamation mark)
Water In Fuel (WIF) lamp (CF only - fuel pump next to a fuel tank)

step1.para: Select D_OutputStateTest.ssn from the Open Session File window, select Open to open the session.
Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off Tests from the drop down menu.

note.para: When using the EST to do KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: From the KOEO Diagnostics menu, select Output State Test Low and select Run to start the test.
Toggle between the Low and High tests in the Output State Test. Listen and observe actuator control or circuit operation.
When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.

svcsubproc.title: Output State High Test

note.para: This test can only be done with the EST; MasterDiagnostics® software is required.

svcsubproc.para: The Output State High test allows the technician to diagnose the operation of the output signals and actuators.
In the Output State High test mode, the ECM pulls up the output voltage to the high state. This actuates the output components controlled by the ECM, energizing the control circuits.

During this test, the output of the circuit in question is monitored with a DMM. The DMM measures a high voltage state, as the outputs are toggled. The actual voltage will vary with the circuit tested.

item.para: A Breakout Box or Breakout Harness and a DMM are required to monitor the suspected circuit or actuator.
DTCs are not set by the ECM during this test.

svcsubproc.para: The following actuators are activated when toggled high during the test:

item.para: Boost Control Solenoid (BCS) (electrical circuit only) visual inspection of actuator arm movement when pressurized with regulated air source. When in low, air is directed to the pneumatic actuator, air bypasses the pneumatic actuator when toggled high.
Horizontal Fuel Conditioning Module (HFCM) fuel pump

step1.para: Select D_OutputStateTest.ssn from the Open Session File window, select Open to open the session.
Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off tests from the drop down menu.

note.para: When using the EST to do KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: From the KOEO Diagnostics menu, select Output State Test High and Run to start the test.
Toggle between the Output State Test Low and the Output State Test High. Listen and observe actuator control or circuit operation.
When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.

svcsubproc.title: Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test

note.para: This test can only be done with the EST; MasterDiagnostics® software is required.

svcsubproc.para: The Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State test allows the technician to determine if the Glow Plug System and the Inlet Air Heater System are operating correctly.

Selecting this test activates the glow plug relay immediately and it stays on for a period of 120 seconds; a DMM and current clamp are used to measure the time the relay is on and the amperage that is drawn for the glow plugs.

The inlet air heater relay operation is activated for 30 seconds. After a three second delay a DMM and current clamp are used to measure the time the relay is on and the amperage that is drawn for the inlet air heater.

step1.para: Select D_OutputStateTest.ssn from the Open Session File window, select Open to open the session.

figure.caption: Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State test

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off tests from the drop down menu.

note.para: When using the EST to do KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: From the KOEO Diagnostics menu, select Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater and select Run to start the test.

note.para: This test can only be run twice for each ignition switch cycle

step1.para: When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.
